cleaned_text: - (2016) Volume 3, Issue 2 There are tremendous reserves of organic compounds found in many plants on Earth that only a very small amount of which as an anti-cancer compounds tested and used. Worldwide endeavors are underway to discover new anti-cancer drugs. Nowadays, there is a proclivity to use of traditional and herbal medicines in cancer treatment. The omission of this paper aimed to investigate the [medicinal plants](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/medicinal-plants-7390.html) which are endemic in many parts of the world and were used for the treatment of various cancers. The evaluated plants and consequently appropriated ones that are used in [cancer](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cancer-26169.html) treatment as well as metabolites that are extracted from which would be useful to scholars around the world. Keywords: Carcinogenic; Anti cancer; Herbal drugs; Medicinal plants; Apoptosis Cell growth and proliferation considered as [cell division](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cell-division-1821.html) and this process must be controlled very closely, so that cells, tissues and organs do their job properly. When [cells](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cells-53612.html) begin to multiply, their high-speed and uncontrolled results could be disastrous. Before a [cell division](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cell-division-1821.html) process to begin during semiconservative [replication](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/replication-13486.html) process on DNA molecules, a copy of one strand is made and then each one in turn is transmitted to daughter [cells](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cells-53612.html) that are similar to each other genetically. Hundreds of different proteins are involved in [cell division](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cell-division-1821.html) and some of them inform you when [cells](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cells-53612.html) divided and when did not. Some of them bear responsibility for monitoring copying DNA to be done correctly. But most of them which are involved in the process of [cell division](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cell-division-1821.html) are responsible for pulling the chromosomes toward the poles of the [cells](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cells-53612.html) were doubled. Uncontrolled [cell division](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cell-division-1821.html) may be attributed to several reasons. But, generally, it is related to one or a number of damaged genes due to uncontrolled cell division. For example, exposure to cigarette smoke or ultraviolet radiation may cause uncontrolled cell division. The damaged [cells](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cells-53612.html) begin to divide and produce an anomalous mass called a tumor [ [1](#1)]. [Cancer](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cancer-26169.html) is the uncontrolled growth of eccentric [cells](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cells-53612.html) in the body and is considered today as a humanitarian disaster and deaths caused by it is steadily rising. It seems that new strategies are needed to prevent and cure [cancer.](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cancer-3081.html) In [cancer](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cancer-26169.html) [management](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/management-22652.html) and treatment, control and survival of cell is important. Anticancer agents must be able to destroy [cancer](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cancer-26169.html) [cells](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cells-53612.html) while limiting side effects on healthy [cells](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cells-53612.html) so that these [cells](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cells-53612.html) have not undergone apoptosis. [Apoptosis](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/apoptosis-5811.html) can be defined as the programmed death of [cells](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cells-53612.html) in diseased cells. This process is a series of morphological changes in the cell that including condensing and fast budding of cells, organs; which ones experienced [apoptosis](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/apoptosis-5811.html) and also cell organelles that are well maintained. Induction of [Apoptosis](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/apoptosis-5811.html) is one of the markers of anti-toxic and anticancer substances. Some natural substances such as metabolites extracted from plants using different mechanisms to induce [apoptosis](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/apoptosis-5811.html) in [cancer](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cancer-26169.html) [cells](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cells-53612.html) that are blocked. Some combinations of plant extracts such as vinca alkaloid compounds, podophyllotoxin and camptothecin in [cancer](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cancer-26169.html) treatment have been used. There are enormous resources of plants on earth that only very few of them have been used in [cancer](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cancer-26169.html) treatment in clinical trials. Nowadays, the most important approaches including chemotherapy, [radiation therapy](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/radiation-therapy-2742.html) or surgery used for [cancer](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cancer-26169.html) treatment, could be successful, however, they have fundamental drawbacks. [Chemotherapy](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/chemotherapy-22709.html) has severe side effects on [cells](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cells-53612.html) and can cause damage to healthy cells. Radiation therapy is effective in tumors that their location is specified exactly. Surgery is effective when the tumor location is well known and is not surrounded by sensitive tissues, such as brain tissue. In the heat hyperthermia approach tissue surrounding [cancer](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cancer-26169.html) [cells](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cells-53612.html) damaged. In the era of Nanotechnology, nanoparticles have the ability to selectively bind to [cancer](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cancer-26169.html) [cells](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cells-53612.html) and these [cells](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cells-53612.html) are sensitive to light [ [2](#2)]. Herbal medicines include herbs, herbal substances and products, plants or a combination of plants before the discovery of new [drugs](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/drugs-3667.html) have being used for more than thousands of years [ [3](#3)]. With the advent of the Industrial revolution and the introduction of new industrial medicine herbs using was forgotten for a long period of time [ [3](#3)].However, using new techniques reduced the obstacles in the way of natural compounds and now there is more interest in the use of natural ingredients in the pharmaceutical industry [ [4](#4), [5](#5)]. According to World Health Organization (WHO), 80% of people in the world using traditional treatment methods [ [6](#6)]. Sixty percent of the global medicines approved by food and agriculture organization of united nation (FAO), between 1984 to1994 have been extracted from natural ingredients especially herbs [ [7](#7)]. Among the 121 medicines for treating cancer, 90 medicines have been extracted from medicinal plants. According to a report among the 65 new [drugs](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/drugs-3667.html) that have been recorded between 1981 and 2002, 48 of which derived from natural products, including: vinca alkaloid (vincristine-vinblastinevindesine- vinorelbine), In 1959 the [medicinal plants](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/medicinal-plants-7390.html) studying with the discovery of drugs; vinblastine and vinca compounds as well as the isolation of cytotoxic compounds such as podophyllotoxin began significantly. These findings prompted the National [Cancer](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cancer-26169.html) Institute in 1960 to collect their plants. The result has discovered new compounds with cytotoxic effects, such as taxan and kamptotoxines. It took 30 years for the [drugs](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/drugs-3667.html) used in [clinical trials](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/clinical-trials-25828.html) influence in different cancers. Endemic anti- carcinogenic plants Plant material is used for the treatment of malignant disease for a few hundred years. Phytochemical examination of plants that have a good history of use in the treatment of [cancer](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cancer-26169.html) in popular culture led to the isolation of compounds that have anti-cancer properties. Since late 1950, an extensive research on plants, [microorganisms](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/microorganisms-2929.html) and marine animals by the National [Cancer](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cancer-26169.html) Institute (NCI) in the United States of America home began with a [screening](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/screening-6818.html) of the original application. Program was consistent [screening](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/screening-6818.html) for new compounds could be found everywhere in the animal kingdom or plant. Given that today more than 50% of [drugs](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/drugs-3667.html) are derived from plants so it is crystal clear that natural resources, especially plants could be drastically used to find effective [drugs](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/drugs-3667.html) for [cancer](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cancer-26169.html) treatment. There was been disagreement in the past that the use of natural resources, especially plants can be time-consuming. However, today using new techniques have been accelerated active plant compounds extraction and this in turn has been recycled medicinal plants. The rebirth of medicines that originated in plants especially ones used for [cancer](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cancer-26169.html) treatment and [autoimmunity](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/autoimmunity-2127.html) is remarkable. The number of herbal ingredients that have been used to treat [cancer](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cancer-26169.html) is not more than 60 combinations. Since there is little information about the usefulness and safety of plant production compared to products commonly consumed more research can improve the appropriate use of herbal preparations. There are some disadvantages in [cancer](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/cancer-26169.html) treatment using chemotherapy, surgery and [radiation therapy](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/radiation-therapy-2742.html) that make challenges in treatment for these methods. [Chemotherapy](https://www.longdom.org/peer-reviewed-journals/chemotherapy-22709.html) often leaves severe adverse effects and can cause damage to healthy cells. Radiation therapy will be effective when the tumor position is well known. Surgery will be effective when tumor location and addition identified but, when sensitive tissues, such as brain tissue surrounding around it, is impossible. Therefore, a new approach in the treatment of cancerous tumors is unavoidable to comment.
